comments.body: Pardon the dumb question, but, why does the new model version not need to load layers? is it part of weights?

In the new code, since ```MultilayerPerceptronClassificationModel``` extends ```MultilayerPerceptronParams```, ```layers``` is one of the Params, and it is set in the next line:
```
metadata.getAndSetParams(model)
```

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +374,378 @@        val data = df.select("weights").head()
        val weights = data.getAs[Vector](0)
        new MultilayerPerceptronClassificationModel(metadata.uid, weights)
      }
      metadata.getAndSetParams(model)

comments.body: Not related to this change. But do we use MultilayerPerceptronClassificationModel in executors? Like not every classification model extends Serializable.
I am not sure about this. Seems only the tree related model extends Serializable.
